A4.text: The destruction of Jerusalem and the Second Temple in 70 CE necessitated a reshaping of Jewish culture to ensure its survival.

A5.text: Rabbinic Judaism, centered around communal synagogue worship and Torah study, eventually evolved out of the Pharisaic school and became the mainstream form of the religion.
